title: nicoseiga_sample
body:
An image sourced from nicoseiga that is sampled, and is not the original image.

Nicoseiga post pages have the following characteristics:

URL: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/seiga/im<[b]image ID[/b]>
Preview: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/thumb/<[b]image ID[/b]>i?
Link: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/image/source/<[b]image ID[/b]>
Fullsize: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/priv/.../.../<[b]image ID[/b]>

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information.

h4. See also

* [[Bad Nicoseiga ID]]: for when any Nicoseiga post or picture are no longer publicly available
* [[MD5 mismatch]]: for when none of the sizes match Danbooru

title: drop_trap
body:
A type of trap commonly used on hard to capture feral cats. It is a container, typically netting over a light frame, that is propped up on one side by a stick. A string is fastened to the stick, so it can be pulled by the trapper to cause the container to completely enclose the prey.

h4. See also

* [[pitfall]]
* [[bear trap]]

title: brilliant_pagoda_or_haze_castle
body:
連縁天影戦記 ("Len'en Ten'eisenki") ~ Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle
("Connecting Link: Heaven & Shadow War Record")

Forth game of the [[Len'en]] series, released June 4, 2015 as a trial. Unlike other shooting games, this one has a cell system, making a "you make your own adventure"-type of game. You go ether left or right to move the bottom bar to your direction. There are three colours in this bar: red (Haze), purple (Neutral) and white (Brilliant). Depending on this, you'll move to different cells, thus at the end you get different bosses on the same stage.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Houlen Yabusame]]/[[Enraku Tsubakura]]/[[shion_(len'en)|Shion]]
* [[Taira no Fumikado]]/[[Fujiwara no Iyozane]]/[[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]/[[Katano Sukune]]/[[Kitsugai Sese]]
* [[Shitodo Kuroji]]/[[Shitodo Hooaka]]/[[Shitodo Aoji]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Boss Haze route: [[Mitsumo]]
* Stage 1 Boss Neutral route: [[Kurohebi]] or [[Amanomiya Jun]]
* Stage 1 Boss Brilliant route: [[Shirami Souko]]
* Stage 2 Boss Haze route: [[Kesa Kujiru]]
* Stage 2 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Aoji]], [[Amanomori Shou]], or [[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* Stage 2 Boss Brilliant route: [[Moritake Medias]]
* Stage 3 Boss Haze route: [[Azuma Kaisen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Neutral route: [[Fujiwara no Iyozane]], [[Kitsugai Sese]], or [[Celeritas Lumen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooya Kunimitsu]]
* Stage 4 Boss Haze route: [[Ogata Garaiya]]
* Stage 4 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Hooaka]], [[Kokutenshi Hibaru]], or [[Adagumo no Saragimaru]]
* Stage 4 Boss Brilliant route: [[Kashiwagi Kaoru]]
* Stage 5 Boss Haze route: [[para_(len'en)|Para]]
* Stage 5 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Kuroji]], [[Katano Sukune]], or [[Taira no Fumikado]]
* Stage 5 Boss Brilliant route: [[Fujiwara no Shirogane no Sanra]]
* Stage 6 Boss Haze route: [[Taira no Chouki]]
* Stage 6 Boss Neutral: [[Houlen Yabusame]], [[Enraku Tsubakura]], [[Clause (len'en)|]], [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]], [[shion_(len'en)|Shion]], or [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]
* Stage 6 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooama no Ake no Mitori]]
* Stage 6 Boss Hidden route: [[Kuzu Suzumi]]
* Extra Stage Boss Haze route: [[Ametsukana Yago]]
* Extra Stage Boss Neutral route: [[Xeno a]]
* Extra Stage Boss Brilliant route: [[Senri Haiji]]
* Extra+α Boss: [[Kuzu Suzumi]] (first disguised as [[Senri Tsurubami]], then as themself)

h4. External links

* "Len'en Wiki: Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle":http://lenen.shoutwiki.com/wiki/Brilliant_pagoda_or_haze_castle

title: ore_to_kanojo_ga_maou_to_yuusha_de_seitokaichou
body:
A light novel by Aikawa Jou and illustrated by [[H2SO4]].  It was published by ASCII Media Works in May 2010 with strong initial sales.  It was recalled in June 2010 due to major plagiarism issues with portions of dialog taken from other works, such as [[Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu]].

The series takes place at a school for humans and non-humans with two opposing student councils, the Hero's student council and the Maou's student council.  The main character's childhood friend becomes the Hero, but somehow he ends up with the position of Maou.  He is now forced to conceal his identity as the Maou from his childhood friend.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Tozawa Koutarou]]
* [[Fushigino Alice]]

h6. Maou's Student Council (Demon King's)

* [[Kujouin Kagami]]
* [[Yukino (Ore to Kanojo ga Maou to Yuusha de Seitokaichou)|Yukino]]
* [[Boushi Yae]]
* [[Lily Lendbrum]]

h6. Yuusha's Student Council (Brave Warrior's)

* [[Moto Yuusha]]
* [[Kongou Musashi]]
* [[Mitsuba Kaede]]
* [[Kurono Magokoro]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長

title: mayo_chiki!
body:
A 2009 light novel series by Asano Hajime, with illustrations by [[Kikuchi Seiji]]. Also adapted into a manga by [[Umibouzu (niito)]], serialized in Media Factory's [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i], a spin-off manga titled [i]Mayo Mayo![/i] (まよまよ!), serialized in Kadokawa Shoten's [i]Nyantype[/i], and a 2011 anime by Feel.

Gynophobic [[Sakamachi Kinjirou]]'s life becomes even more complicated when he discovers that [[Konoe Subaru]], butler to [[Suzutsuki Kanade]], daughter of their school's principal, is actually a [[reverse_trap|crossdressing girl]]. After being blackmailed by Kanade into keeping silent about her secret, Kinjirou becomes Subaru's confidant and her closest friend in school.

h4. Characters

* [[Konoe Subaru]]
* [[Masamune Usami]]
* [[Narumi Nakuru]]
* [[Sakamachi Kinjirou]]
* [[Sakamachi Kureha]]
* [[Suzutsuki Kanade]]

h4. External links

* "Official Light Novel Site":http://www.mediafactory.co.jp/bunkoj/mayochiki/
* "Official Anime Site":http://www.starchild.co.jp/special/mayochiki/
* "Wikipedia: Mayo Chiki!":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mayo_Chiki%21

title: double_spoiler
body:
ダブルスポイラー ～ 東方文花帖 "Double Spoiler ~ Touhou Bunkachou"

Seventeenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, twelfth in the Windows generation, and fifth spinoff, as well as the second spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Also known as "Touhou 12.5", released 14 March 2010 at Reitaisai 7.

The game marks the return of [[Shameimaru Aya]] on another round of picture-taking escapades, this time covering various characters from [[Mountain of Faith]] to [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], including recurring protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]], as well as characters introduced in the fighting spinoffs: [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Nagae Iku]] and [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] - but now with competition in the form of [[himekaidou_hatate|a rival journalist]].

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Shameimaru Aya]]
* [[Himekaidou Hatate]]

h5. Enemies

* Level 1: [[Aki Shizuha]] and [[Aki Minoriko]]
* Level 2: [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] and [[Kagiyama Hina]]
* Level 3: [[Kurodani Yamame]], [[Kisume]] and [[Tatara Kogasa]]
* Level 4: [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Level 5: [[Kumoi Ichirin]] and [[Murasa Minamitsu]]
* Level 6: [[Ibuki Suika]] and [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]]
* Level 7: [[Toramaru Shou]] and [[Nazrin]]
* Level 8: [[Kaenbyou Rin]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]]
* Level 9: [[Komeiji Satori]] and [[Komeiji Koishi]]
* Level 10: [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] and [[Nagae Iku]]
* Level 11: [[Yasaka Kanako]] and [[Moriya Suwako]]
* Level 12: [[Hijiri Byakuren]] and [[Houjuu Nue]]
* Level EX: [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Aya): Himekaidou Hatate
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Hatate): Shameimaru Aya

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Double Spoiler":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Double_Spoiler

title: ten_desires
body:
東方神霊廟 ("Touhou Shinreibyou") ~ Ten Desires
("Divine Spirit Mausoleum")

Nineteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth of the mainstream lineup, and fourteenth overall game of the Windows generation, as well as the eighth mainstream game of the same generation.

A large number of divine spirits are running free. Knowing this can't be left unchecked, [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] decides to investigate. Joining as usual is [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]. Intent on furthering her training, [[Kochiya Sanae]] joins once again, this time to achieve that goal by learning how to use these spirits more effectively. [[Konpaku Youmu]] also joins for the first time since [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]], so that she may deal with the spirits not under her control.

h4. Characters

h5. Heroines

* [[Hakurei Reimu]] 
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* [[Konpaku Youmu]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Boss: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] (reappearance)
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Kasodani Kyouko]]

title: yousei_daisensou
body:
妖精大戦争 ～ 東方三月精 ("Yousei Daisensou ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")
("Great Fairy Wars ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")

Eighteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth in the Windows generation, sixth spinoff overall, and third spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Numbered "Touhou 12.8" and released 14 August 2010 at Comiket 78.

The game is based on the [i]Sangetsusei[/i] manga series ([i]Eastern and Little Nature Deity[/i], [i]Strange and Bright Nature Deity[/i] and [i]Oriental Sacred Place[/i]), with artwork by [i]Sangetsusei[/i] artist [[Hirasaka Makoto]], making the game the first collaborative spinoff not involving Tasogare Frontier.

In her first-ever protagonist role, [[Cirno]] declares war on the Three Mischievous Fairies - [[Luna Child]], [[Sunny Milk]] and [[Star Sapphire]] - in their first in-game appearance.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Cirno]]

h5. Enemies

h6. Mid-boss

* [[Lily White]]
* [[Lily Black]]
* [[Daiyousei]]

h6. Boss

* [[Sunny Milk]]
* [[Luna Child]]
* [[Star Sapphire]]

h6. Extra Boss

* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Fairy Wars":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fairy_Wars

title: kijin_seija
body:
The "Counterattacking Amanojaku."  Stage 5 midboss and boss, and stage 6 midboss, of [[Touhou]] [[Double Dealing Character]] and protagonist of [[Impossible Spell Card]].

She has the power to flip anything over, and has extreme contrarian tendencies; liking whatever others dislike, becoming unhappy whenever others are happy, saying the opposite of what she really means, and so on. She is the instigator of the plot of Double Dealing Character, manipulating [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] into helping her create a world where the weak will rule over the strong.

She has two [[small horns|small]] [[grey horns|grey]] (or [[white horns|white]]) [[cone horns]] on the top of her head and [[short hair|short]] [[multicolored hair]] of [[black hair|black]], [[white hair|white]], and [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. She wears a [[multicolored dress]] of the [[white dress|same]] [[red dress|set of]] [[black dress|colors]] with an [[arrow print]] on the [[print dress|bottom]] and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[blue sash]] with a [[waist bow|bow]] on her [[back bow|back]], and [[sandals]].

h4. See also

* [[Nimble fabric]]
* "Touhou - God Damn It Seija!":/pools/7355 - A pool of Seija reversing things at the expense of other people.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Seija Kijin":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Seija_Kijin

title: nimble_fabric
body:
The [[purple]] [[checkered]] [[fabric]] that [[Kijin Seija]] uses as a tool in [[Impossible Spell Card]]. It allows Seija to briefly hide in the nimble, becoming invincible but immobile and harmless.

It is a parody of [[Doraemon]]'s "Hirari Mantle":[https://strategywiki.org/wiki/Doraemon/Items#Shooter_items].

title: impossible_spell_card
body:
弾幕アマノジャク ("Danmaku Amanojaku") ～ Impossible Spell Card

The 14.3rd official installment of the [[Touhou]] games, featuring [[Kijin Seija]] as the protagonist. The game was released 11 May 2014, at Reitaisai 11. As the title implies, it is a spinoff game consisting mostly of spell cards that would be impossible (or nearly impossible) to beat in regular [i]Touhou[/i] games, but the player disposes of various "cheat items", each with its particular ability, as a help to defeat the enemies.

body:

body:

("Gathering Dreams in the East")

Eighth game in the [[Touhou]] series, third in the Windows generation, and first spinoff, as well as the first fighting spinoff made in collaboration with Tasogare Frontier. Labeled as "Touhou 7.5".

An incessant occurrence of feasts began troubling residents of [[Gensokyo]], thus only 3 days before another such feast occurs, 6 girls decide to investigate and filter out the source - a [[ibuki_suika|party-loving oni]] who hopes that the feasts finally lure her fellow oni out of centuries of hiding underground.

title: imperishable_night
body:
東方永夜抄 ("Touhou Eiyashou") ~ Imperishable Night
("Eternal Night Vignette from the East")

Ninth game of the [[Touhou]] series, eighth of the mainstream lineup, and fourth of the Windows generation, as well as the third mainstream game in the same generation.

On the eve of the Harvest Moon Festival in [[Gensokyo]], youkai sense that the moon has been stolen and replaced with a false one. Someone must freeze time and find the real moon to ensure a full moon on the night of the festival. To this end, a pair of a human and a youkai (4 pairs in total) go in search of the real moon, leading them to a [[yagokoro_eirin|genius pharmacist]] and her charge, the [[houraisan_kaguya|exiled princess of the Moon]].

title: phantasmagoria_of_flower_view
body:
東方花映塚 ("Touhou Kaeizuka") ~ Phantasmagoria of Flower View
("Oriental Flower Viewing Mound")

Tenth game in the [[Touhou]] series, ninth in the mainstream lineup, fifth in the Windows generation, and fourth mainstream game in the same generation.

An unusual spring has befallen in [[Gensokyo]] - flowers from all seasons start blooming at the same time. Various girls, with various reasons, wander around gathering clues in search of a solution, one which will lead them to a [[onozuka_komachi|lackadaisical shinigami]] and her [[Shiki Eiki|busybody employer]].

The game features the "versus system" introduced in the PC-98 generation's [[Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream]].

Notorious for its manual, which gave Cirno her nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]".

body:

("Chronicles of the Wind God of the East")

Twelfth game in the [[Touhou]] series, tenth in the mainstream lineup, and seventh in the Windows generation, as well as the fifth mainstream game in the same generation.

One autumn, a [[kochiya_sanae|mysterious stranger]] approaches the Hakurei Shrine and orders it closed to make way for the Moriya Shrine atop Youkai Mountain. A displeased [[Hakurei Reimu]] and a bored [[Kirisame Marisa]] decide to enter Youkai Mountain - a place forbidden to humans - to confront the [[yasaka_kanako|new goddess]] atop the mountain.

title: hidan_no_aria
body:
An ongoing 2008 light novel series by Akamatsu Chuugaku and illustrated by [[Kobuichi]], with an ongoing 2009 manga adaptation illustrated by [[Koyoka Yoshino]], a spring 2011 anime adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]], and an ongoing 2010 spinoff manga [[Hidan no Aria AA]] illustrated by Tachibana Shogako, with its own anime adaptation by J.C. Staff. 

On the way to school, [[Tooyama Kinji]], a student of Tokyo Butei High, a prestigious school which trains youths to become "Butei" - armed civilian law enforcers - nearly fell victim to a serial bomber known as the "Butei Killer", were he not saved by [[kanzaki h. aria|Kanzaki H. Aria]], his diminutive schoolmate and an elite gunner/swordsman. Despite his misgivings about his life as a Butei, Kinji nevertheless joins her in hunting down the "Butei Killer" before more of their schoolmates are endangered.

h4. Characters

title: a_song_of_ice_and_fire
body:
A high fantasy novel series by American author [[George R.R. Martin]], running since 1996 with five novels (out of a projected seven) as of 2012.

The saga revolves around three interconnected stories, set in a world where summer and winter can last decades: a seven-way war for the throne of Westeros, a looming threat of supernatural beings from beyond a massive wall of ice as a long winter approaches, and an exiled princess' quest to retake Westeros from the usurpers who killed her father.

The saga is unique among its genre for its impartial third-person point-of-view provided by dozens of characters of differing allegiances and personalities, as well as toning down the genre's more fantastic elements in favor of battles, political intrigue and moral ambiguity.


h4. Books 

* 1: "A Game of Thrones":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Game_of_Thrones (August 1996) 
* 2: "A Clash of Kings":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Clash_of_Kings (February 1999) 
* 3: "A Storm of Swords":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Storm_of_Swords (November 2000) 
* 4: "A Feast for Crows":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Feast_for_Crows (November 2005) 
* 5: "A Dance with Dragons":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Dance_with_Dragons (July 2011) 
* 6: The Winds of Winter (TBA) 
* 7: A Dream of Spring (TBA) 

h4. See also 

* [[Game of Thrones]] - The television adaptation of the novel
* [[House of the Dragon]] - The television adaptation of the Targaryen civil war Dance of the Dragons

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: A Song of Ice and Fire":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire 
* "A Wiki of Fire and Ice":http://awoiaf.westeros.org/

title: final_fantasy_iii
body:
Third J-RPG developed by Square Co., Ltd. (later [[Square Enix]]) for the [[Final Fantasy]] series. It was first released on the NES system in 27 April 1990, and later re-released on Nintendo DS as an enhanced remake in 2006.
